Yes, it is common for host cities of Paralympic Games to provide various initiatives and programs aimed at raising awareness and understanding of disability issues among the public. The Athens Paralympic Games may have done this by:

1. Educational Programs: Athens may have provided educational programs and events that promote awareness and understanding of disability issues. These may include workshops, seminars, and forums that educate people on the challenges and opportunities that people with disabilities face.

2. Volunteer Trainings: The Athens Paralympic Games may have provided volunteer trainings that provide sensitivity training and education on disability issues. This could help volunteers interact and assist people with disabilities in a more informed and respectful manner.

3. Social Media and Marketing: Athens may have used social media and marketing campaigns to raise awareness about disability issues and promote the Paralympic Games. This could include campaigns that showcase the abilities of people with disabilities or events that will take place during the Games.

4. Accessibility Programs: Athens may have created initiatives and programs aimed at promoting accessibility for all people with disabilities. This could include accessibility audits, disability training, and awareness initiatives that promote the removal of physical and social barriers.

Overall, the Athens Paralympic Games may have used a range of programs and initiatives to raise awareness and understanding of disability issues among the public in Greece and worldwide. Through these programs, they could have helped promote a more inclusive and accessible society for all people with disabilities.
